Indeed, by the 'Asr [al-'asr], God the Exalted has swornâ€”and it is the time following the zenith until sunsetâ€”to indicate the immense significance of watching over the times [al-awqat] and filling them with acts of obedience ['ibadat], as He, the Exalted, has said: "By the 'Asr [al-'asr]." From this oath, it becomes clear that the supreme intended purpose from the creation of the night and the day and the measuring of the sun and the moon by calculation is not merely benefiting from the affairs of the world [al-dunya], but rather so that the servant may know the measures of times [al-azminah] and occupy every portion of them with trade for the Hereafter [al-akhirah], as He, the Exalted, has clarified in His saying: "And He is the One who made the night and the day in succession for whoever desires to remember or desires gratitude." So let that be a path to the pleasure [ridwan] of God and to attaining success through His sought-after bounty.

ğŸ“– Vol 3: Condemnation of Self-Delusion
And let us return to the intended purpose, so the intended meaning is that the deception of Satan that the Hereafter is doubt is repelled either by traditional certainty, or by insight and witnessing from the aspect of the inner dimension, and the believers with their tongues and with their beliefs if they neglect the commands of Allah the Exalted and abandon righteous works and associate with desires and disobediences, they are partners with the disbelievers in this deception from the Fire even if after a while, but they are also among the deceived for they acknowledged that the Hereafter is better than the worldly life but they inclined to the worldly life and preferred it, and mere faith is not sufficient for success. Allah the Exalted said: "And indeed, I am Forgiving to whoever repents and believes and does righteous work then is guided" and Allah the Exalted said: "Indeed, the mercy of Allah is near to the doers of good" then the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "Excellence (Ihsan) is that you worship Allah as if you see Him"[5] and Allah the Exalted said: "By the time (Al-Asr), indeed, mankind is in loss, except those who have believed and done righteous works and advised each other to truth and advised each other to patience." So the promise of forgiveness in all the Book of Allah the Exalted is conditional upon faith and righteous work together, not upon faith alone, so these are also deceived, I mean those who are content with the worldly life, joyful in it, luxuriating in its pleasures, loving it. Those who hate death fearing the loss of the delights of the worldly life, not those who hate it fearing what comes after it, so this is an example of deception by the worldly life from the disbelievers and the believers altogether.
